intro: Nauclea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy nauclea, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Nauclea hirsuta is often found in moist, wooded areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
